definitions.definition: the work of repairing and cleaning an old building, a painting, etc. so that its condition is as good as it originally was

examples.text: The palace is closed for restoration.
The government did much to facilitate these restorations.
This historic building is currently awaiting restoration.

definitions.definition: the act of bringing back a system, a law, etc. that existed previously

examples.text: the restoration of diplomatic relations between the two countries
Protesters called for the full restoration of civil liberties.
the full restoration of Sino-US relations

definitions.definition: the act of returning something to its correct place, condition or owner

examples.text: the restoration of the Elgin marbles to Greece

definitions.definition: the time in Britain after 1660 when, following a period with no king or queen, Charles II became king

examples.text: Restoration comedy/poetry *(= written during and after this time)*

wordOrigin: late 15th cent. (denoting the action of restoring to a former state): partly from Old French, partly an alteration of obsolete restauration (from late Latin restauratio(n-), from the verb restaurare), suggested by restore.
